body.name: Camaflexi Shaker Style 6 Shelf Bookcase / Solid Wood / 72 inch Tall / Adjustable Shelving / Closed Back / Display Bookshelf for Living Room, Bedroom, Home and Office, Cherry
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Monday, February 19. Order within 1 hr 3 mins
features: One bookcase of six shelves included in purchase
Feature 6 shelves, 4 adjustable shelves and 2 fixed shelves
Closed back prevents items from falling off rear of bookcase
Includes wall mounted anti-tip kit for extra security
Shelving units can be placed side by side
body.description: Camaflexi's Shaker Bookcase is designed to be space efficient while providing you with the storage that you need! This single unit, solid wood bookcase features six deep, extra generous shelves. It is protected with a multi-step, easy to clean, finish that enhances the natural beauty of the grains. The traditional Shaker style is beautiful and timeless, lending the perfect touch to any room. Sturdy and durable, this piece is built to last – the quality and workmanship you’ve come to expect from Camaflexi. Concerned for the environment, all Camaflexi furniture is eco-friendly and crafted of 100% Solid Pine Wood sourced from renewable pine plantations.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 25, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great product for the price point
reviews.reviewText: These bookcases are beautiful!. I purchased 3 for a space because the size would fit perfectly.Pros: beautiful finish. Cabinets at home depot don't even have this nice of finish.Easy to put together not a lot of parts.Dowels and pocket hole screws make for sturdy construction.Has more shelves than other units of its size.Cons: One had a Crack showing on the side. Not sure if it is just the finish as that is sometimes the nature of wood or if it will effect structural integrity of shelf. The damage may have been caused In Transport as the delivery person dropped them on my porch. I offered to help carry or to deliver to garage so they wouldn't have t walk up steps but they declined and dropped each on consecutively.Tips: glue dowels.The screws provided are not pocket hole screws that self drill so go slow or drive in a little and back out to create false predrill. Instead of putting together Flat lay one side on floor put glue in holes, add dowels, ad glue to top of dowels and place parts into side then insert screws. Make sure bottom and shelf are oriented towards the frontbor vack cirrectly there is a difference. Repeat by adding glue in holes of the shelf and supports sticking up then line up other side with dowel and tap into place and screw into place.Install top by laying shelf on its back.06 is top support 09 is bottom supportSuggestions to manufacturer: include pocket hole screws. And maybe touch up finish.Overall: nice product would buy again. Waiting for reply from manufacturer regarding damaged side giving it 5 stars for now. Will update if repairs and or returns become a hassle. Note that in photos it show shelf sitting flush to each other which is on of the reasons I purchased. This is not the case the top overhangs sides a bit so there is a gap when they sit side by side.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars This is a great shelf...and it's real wood!
reviews.reviewText: I wish I could have given it 6 stars! Instructions were clear. Everything fitted correctly and it's an attractive piece of furniture. This was a surprise: It's made of real solid wood, not composition. It was no more money than composition. It was made in Brazil, not China. Win-win!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This is a great bookcase. It is perfect for the space we have available. It's all wood and easy to assemble.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 3, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars A good sturdy, wooden bookcase
reviews.reviewText: This bookcase is quite sturdy and classic looking. It smells of wood but isnt strong or unpleasant. The build process was pretty self explanatory except for the last bit where you nail the backing onto the back. Be careful that you place the backing in a place where there is enough wood for the nail to go into without poking through. The shelf distance provides adequate space for the items i want to present and the look of books on this piece is splendid. If you want a good ol bookcase to include in your room this one is for sure the one for you.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Sturdy construction, clear instructions, I built it myself alone, carefully (70 yr old woman) and I sawed the backing in half and only mounted on the bottom half. Still sturdy, but has a lighter open feel with the white painted wall showing in upper half.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Very good bookshelf
reviews.reviewText: This bookshelf is sturdy and easy to assemble. The components are high quality--not junk particle board or pressboard. Instructions are clear. The finish is nice and the looks are classy.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2024
Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Exceptionally well packaged
reviews.reviewText: I purchased two of these bookcases. Both were exceptionally well packaged and arrived damage free, despite being shipped by USPS. These bookcases are made in Brazil, of softwood (pine) and well finished. Assembly was easy and everything fit properly. All you need is a Philips screw driver and a small hammer.Very pleased with this purchase. I think they represent good value for the money. Manufacturer should be commended for such careful and thoughtful packaging. I was really impressed. If I need another small bookcase, these will be on my shortlist!

reviews.reviewTitle: Nice bookcase but a little expensive
reviews.reviewText: Very nice book shelf, but a little pricey.
